result.execSummary:
The defendant Lamonte W Moore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: AS TO BOTH COUNTS: Provide a DNA sample, if not already done. Pay court costs, fees, assessment and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to be paid through collection by the DOC's from 25% of funds undr Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance shall be due no later than 12-31-19.
CONCURRENT WITH EACH OTHER AS TO BOTH COUNTS AND CASE #15CF2107, with credit for 162 days

superMiscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety; No possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
- DOC's must conduct drug and alcohol testing.
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- Regularly participate in an HSED or GED program until completed.
- Maintain full time employment/school or a combination of both.
- Defendant to not associate with any known gang memeber, associate or affiliate.
- Mental Health Evaluation and any recommended treatment.
- Court recommends Trauma Informed Mental Health Treatment.
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Drivers license suspension is not imposed.

supervisions.notes:
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firarm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor. Defefendant may not live where a firearm is kept. Defendant may not be in any automobile where a firearm is present. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: Firearm possession and Voting.

Court advises the defendant that under Wisconsin Statue 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to ES, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the defendant being returned to prison.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lamonte W Moore

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Certification of transcript of proceedings of GUILTY PLEA/SENTENCING HEARING commencing 10-14-2015 received and filed. (32 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to INSTITUTION.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State and defense.

AS TO COUNT 1 -
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 48 MONTHS, concurrent with Count 2 in 15CF1610 and case 15CF2107, with credit for 162 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 24 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 24 MONTHS.  

Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.

AS TO COUNT 2 -
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 48 MONTHS, concurrent with Count 1 in 15CF1610 and case 15CF2107, with credit for 162 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 24 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 24 MONTHS.  

Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 

AS TO COUNT 1 AND 2 -
- Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance shall be due no later than 12/31/19, failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.  
- Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing.
 - No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution. 
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
- Defendant may not live where a firearm is kept. 
- Defendant may not be in any automobile where a firearm is present. 
- Regularly participate in an HSED or GED program until completed. 
- Maintain fulltime employment/school or a combination of both. 
- Defendant to not associate with any known gang member, associate or affiliate. 
- Mental Health Evaluation and any recommended treatment. 
- Court recommends Trauma Informed Mental Health Treatment. 
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Drivers license suspension is not imposed.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: firearm possession and voting.

Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison. 

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Lamonte W Moore in court with attorney Craig Robert Johnson.  Defendant Lamonte W Moore in custody.  Brandon Wigley on behalf of Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for plea/sentencing hearing.

AS TO COUNT 1 AND 2 :

The defendant was advised of his Constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Case proceeded to sentencing.

Attorney Craig Robert Johnson in court, defendant Lamonte W Moore not in court, in custody, in holding area.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Held off the record. Case set for plea and sentencing hearing. Defense counsel requesting an adjournment. Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 10-14-2015 at 8:30 am.  Court notes no objection to this case being transferred, if approved by Court.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Konkol, Br. 17.  aw
This assignment is only effective as of 8/3/2015.  aw

Defendant Lamonte W Moore in court with attorney Craig Robert Johnson.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Court advised parties that as of August 3, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Daniel Konkol, Branch 44 in Room 316 of the Safety Building. Substitution filed.  Case is now assigned to Judge Stark.  Court contacted Judge Stark court for the next court date.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 8/24/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 17.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Craig Robert Johnson in court, defendant Lamonte W Moore not in court, in custody.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has filed a motion for protective order.   Order signed and filed.  Discovery was turned over today.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 6/15/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lamonte W Moore in court with attorney Craig Robert Johnson.  Defendant Lamonte W Moore in custody. Marissa Santiago for Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Jake Puschnig-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 03.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Lamonte W Moore in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Defendant Lamonte W Moore in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
